method.name: GET
method.doc: Find the Jaroâ€“Winkler string distance between two strings of data

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format.

param.name: info1
param.doc: Info1 must be a JSON of the data you would like to classify, with key-value pairs of info and class. Info is the data, and class is the classifier associated with the info data for the training. Example: [ {"info": "short bitcoin", "class": "sell"}, {"info": "long bitcoin", "class": "buy"} ] . The example data is url encoded

param.name: what
param.doc: Data you would like classified based on training data.

param.name: apikey
param.doc: API Keys are required to make requests. To get your API key, visit alinaAPI.com

method.doc: This endpoint provides the stem word of each word passed. For example, "walked" will be "walk". "Ran" will be run. "Helicopters" will be "Helicopter".

method.doc: Closest Constant provides a way of determining patterns between two time series arrays (great for finding Bitcoin trading patterns)

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format.

param.name: what
param.doc: Get beneficial bitcoin trade predictions based on neural networks learning from bitcoin movement along with genetic algorithms looking for the best solutions. "what" parameter indicates what interval to analyze. Currently, minutely is the only supported interval and works from 5-30 minute interval of trades.

param.name: limit
param.doc: Number of search result pages that will be queried in your subject. About 20-60 e-mails are returned per page on average. Every page adds about 1 minute to your wait time for a response.
